intro: Faucibarba acinos, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and typically grows in rocky or alpine environments. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple, often with a white or yellow throat. It has a compact growth habit with hairy leaves and is well adapted to cold, high-altitude climates. Faucibarba acinos is often used in rock gardens and alpine gardens due to its ornamental value and hardiness.
